elements.title: Forever Young (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that fans speculate that Forever Young (pictured), the winner of the Saudi Derby, might become a "horse girl" in the game Uma Musume Pretty Derby?

elements.title: Addie Viola Smith (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Addie Viola Smith was the first female Foreign Service officer to serve under the United States Department of Commerce?

elements.title: first coup d'état in Roman history (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 88 BC, Lucius Cornelius Sulla carried out the first coup d'état in Roman history?

elements.title: Mike Watts (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during a soccer game, Mike Watts and his co-commentator wove more than 200 Taylor Swift song titles into the broadcast?

elements.title: Bedok Reservoir MRT station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bedok Reservoir MRT station features a public artwork including a message that "dribbles down" the lift shaft in motifs of droplets?

elements.title: a documentary (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cinda Firestone, the heiress to the Firestone Tire and Rubber Company, directed a documentary about the 1971 Attica Prison riot?

elements.title: Joseph Déjacque (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 1850s New Orleans, the French revolutionary Joseph Déjacque called for black slaves and the white working class to overthrow the United States in a social revolution?

elements.title: The Ugly Black Bird (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Ugly Black Bird, a Polish book that discredited the autobiographical value of Kosiński's The Painted Bird, initially received reviews that were "more negative than favourable"?

elements.title: Cam Booser (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Cam Booser retired from baseball to work as a carpenter in 2017 and made it to Major League Baseball in 2024?
